intro: Terpsichore nana, commonly known as the dwarf terpsichore, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
